posts.post_content:
Dependant on format you'll certainly want to play [Goblin Matron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Matron) instead.  
It costs ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol), has one power less, but lets you put the card into your hand, meaning there no card disadvantage for you.

Posted By: ax_morph (10/26/2011 4:25:04 PM)

posts.post_content:
Play this, tutor [Boggart Mob](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boggart Mob), play Mob next turn championing this. If Boggart Mob dies or is exiled, this comes back into play, and you get to fetch another goblin, preferrably another Boggart Mob so you can repeat the cycle.  
  
I prefer [Goblin Matron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Matron) though. [Goblin Recruiter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Recruiter) is even better, obviously, but my friends would probably dip my deck in lighter fluid and set it on fire, so I'll settle for Matron.
posts.html:
Play this, tutor Boggart Mob, play Mob next turn championing this. If Boggart Mob dies or is exiled, this comes back into play, and you get to fetch another goblin, preferrably another Boggart Mob so you can repeat the cycle.

I prefer Goblin Matron though. Goblin Recruiter is even better, obviously, but my friends would probably dip my deck in lighter fluid and set it on fire, so I'll settle for Matron.
